text: Shikak Tribe Jointly with the Ottoman Army he organized the massacre in Haftevan in February 1915 during which 700–800 Armenians and Assyrians were murdered. ==Massacre== The Haftevan massacre (Syriac: ܛܘܐ ܕܗܦܬܒ) was a massacre that took place in 1915 during the World War I, in which Ottoman forces and Kurdish collaborators attacked the Assyrian village of Haftevan in northwestern Iran, and killed between 750 and 800 Assyrians and Armenians.http://www.aina.org/books/hannibal-travis-2018.pdf p.145-146 Gaunt, David (2020). "When Perpetual Persecution Becomes Ottoman Genocide". Bustan: The Middle East Book Review. 11 (1): 1–19. doi:10.5325/bustan.11.1.0001. ISSN 1878-5301. JSTOR 10.5325/bustan.11.1.0001 Gaunt, David (2006). Massacres, Resistance, Protectors: Muslim-Christian Relations in Eastern Anatolia During World War I. Gorgias Press. pp. 81, 83–84. ISBN 978-1-59333-301-0. The massacre was part of the wider Assyrian Genocide and Armenian genocide. ==References== Category:Massacres
